menu.name: Baked Potatoes
menu.description: Aromatic, nourishing, hissing homemade potatoes stuffed with creamy bacon filling. A baked potato, or jacket potato, is a potato that has been baked for eating. When well cooked, a baked potato has a fluffy interior and a crisp skin. It may be served with fillings and condiments such as butter, cheese, sour cream, gravy or even ground meat.

menu.name: Maghreb Tomato Soup
menu.description: Tomato Maghreb soup is especially common in Morocco and Tunisia. It is very simple to prepare and in itself is light - based on tomatoes and chicken broth. In addition to them in the soup, only the necessary spices, honey and lemon, which all together convey that same oriental flavor. The taste of the soup is entirely dependent on the quality of the tomatoes.

menu.name: Pumpkin Cream Soup
menu.description: A portrait of this orange broth adorns the cover of Paul La Bocuse’s book “La Cuisine du Marché”. Bocuse, who invented the so-called new kitchen, considered the pumpkin to be one of the foundations of this world order, and pumpkin soup was a kind of amniotic water in gastronomy.

menu.name: Red Bean Salad with Curd Cheese
menu.description: Tuscan salad seasoned in the colors of the Italian flag. Just a few spoons are enough to form a pleasant heaviness in the stomach. A very useful thing from the point of view of the morning, when it is difficult to shove large doses of biomass in yourself, but you also want to eat. In addition to arugula, leaves of corn salad and sorrel feel confidently in this salad, but the green garlic behaves most ideally.

menu.name: Classic Greek Salad
menu.description: This is a recipe from an old cookbook brought from Greece. The secret of the salad - the freshest vegetables and a good feta.

menu.name: Muffins with blueberries and nutmeg
menu.description: The cult berry, which they learned to produce all year round, in combination with loose dough, is absolutely a win-win. Blueberry muffins have become a popular dessert in England and America, although their origin is French. And indeed, these little sweet cupcakes, as we know them now, were conceived as ordinary bread and tasted neutral.

menu.name: Pasta with Lamb Ragù
menu.description: For this exceptional restaurant dish, we tosse large hollow pasta tubes (paccheri) with chunks of lamb, tomato ragù and grated Pecorino. Bissonnette finishes the dish with mint from the same pasture where the lamb grazed. When he can't find paccheri, he makes sheep's-milk-ricotta gnocchi instead.

menu.name: Chinese Fried Rice with Egg
menu.description: Fried rice is a fairly common ingredient in East Asian dishes - in essence, you can cook from the remnants of yesterday's dinner. Only the well-cooled, pre-cooked rice, ideally standing for the whole night in the refrigerator, will not spread to the state of porridge when it enters the hot wok and does not turn the contents of the pan into a clumsy shapeless clod.

menu.name: Grilled Ribbs
menu.description: These beef ribs—leftovers from the giant rib roast—are incredibly luscious. Chef Tim Love douses them in his sweet and tangy homemade barbecue sauce, then cooks them on the grill until they're crusty, sizzling and outrageously good.

menu.name: Cheesecake
menu.description: This is a cheese mousse cake on a thin waffle base. Its taste is quite tender, but the cake itself is nourishing, it is unlikely to eat much at one time. We can say with confidence that if you have never tried Cheesecake, then there is simply nothing to compare it with, it has its own, unique, delicate creamy cheese flavor.
